alert.note: Alert for Dallas; Polk (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 7:17PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...An area of thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Polk and east central Dallas Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 715 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dallas Center, or near Waukee, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and additional heavy rainfall of one to two inches. Heavy rainfall with low visibility is expected. Travelers may experience difficult driving conditions on area highways and interstates. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Ponding of ponding of water on roadways, low visibilities, and rises in small streams and creeks. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Waukee around 725 PM CDT. Urbandale around 730 PM CDT. Grimes and Jordan Creek Town Center around 735 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Valley West Mall, West Des Moines, Johnston, Clive and Windsor Heights. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 71 and 72. Interstate 80 between mile markers 120 and 130. Interstate 235 between mile markers 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
